column3: Description
Variable to define the Postgres Database endpoint.
Tells the application which RPC Client the node is using (i.e. `erigon`, `geth`, `nethermind`, `besu`, or `ganache`) ([See Client Settings for more info](client-settings.md))
The RPC endpoint used to fetch blocks, transactions, receipts, tokens.
Variable to define the Postgres Database read-only replica endpoint. If it is provided, most of the read queries from API v2 and UI would go through this endpoint.
The RPC endpoint specifically for the Erigon/Geth/Nethermind/Besu client used by trace\_block and trace\_replayTransaction. This can be used to designate a tracing node.
The WebSockets RPC endpoint used to subscribe to the `newHeads` subscription alerting the indexer to fetch new blocks.
Specifies the transport for Blockscout to connect to the Ethereum Node. Available transports are `http` and `ipc`. If `ipc` is selected, also set `IPC_PATH` variable.

If `true` is set, allows insecure HTTP connections to the archive node. For instance, it allows to bypass expired SSL certificate at the archive node endpoint. Implemented in (#6573)\[https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6573]
Timeout for ethereum json rpc http requests in seconds. Implemented in (#7089)[https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7089]
User in basic auth for JSON RPC endpoint. Implemented in (#6897)[https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6897]
Password in basic auth for JSON RPC endpoint. Implemented in (#6897)[https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6897]

Custom headers for JSON RPC endpoint in form of json object, example: `{"x-api-key": "nbvkhadvnbkdfav", "x-id": "ndjkfvndfkjv"}`. Implemented in (#7898)[https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7898]
Environment variable for the main EVM network such as Ethereum or POA.
Environment variable for the subnetwork such as Core or Sokol Network. This will be displayed as selected in the chains list dropdown.
Path to the IPC file of the running node if IPC transport is chosen.
Used to set a network path other than what is displayed in the root directory. An example would be to add `/eth/mainnet/` to the root directory.
Host for API endpoint examples.
Url scheme for blockscout.
column4: in prod env `https` is used, in dev env `http` is used

column3: Use mix phx.gen.secret to generate a new Secret Key Base string to protect production assets.
Used to check the origin of requests when the origin header is present. It defaults to `false`. In case of true, it will check against the host value.
Default port the application runs on is 4000.
The coin here is checked via the CoinGecko API to obtain USD prices on graphs and other areas of the UI.
Displayed name of the coin. Also used for "Add chain to MetaMask" button and for Account functionality as native coin name in the email letters for watch list.
Should be set to `POA` if you have block emission identical to POA Network. This env var is used only if `CHAIN_SPEC_PATH` is set.
Chain specification path (absolute file system path or URL) to import block emission reward ranges and genesis account balances from. Geth- and OpenEthereum-style specs are supported.
This environment variable is used by the xDai Chain/RSK in order to tell the application how to calculate the total supply of the chain. Available values are `TokenBridge`, `RSK`
Variable to define the number of database connections allowed excluding read-only API endpoints requests.
Variable to define the number of database connections allowed for read-only API endpoints requests.
Production environment variable to use SSL on Ecto queries.
Production environment variable to restart the application in the event of a crash.
Production environment variable to restart the application in the event of a crash.
Elixir version to install on the node before Blockscout deploy. It is used in bash script in Terraform / Ansible deployment script
Default transaction hash in a sample query to GraphiQL.
If `true`, endpoints to webapp are hidden (compile-time). Also, enabling it makes notifications go through `db_notify`
If `true`, read-only endpoints to API v1 are hidden (compile-time).
If `true`, write endpoints to API v1 are hidden (compile-time).
Link to web application instance, e.g. `protocol://host/path`
Link to API instance, e.g. `protocol://host/path`
If set to `true`, redirects to checksummed version of address hashes.
Defines checksum address function. 2 available values: `rsk`, `eth`
A comma-separated list of addresses to enable restricted access to them.
A key to access addresses listed in`RESTRICTED_LIST` variable. Can be passed via query param to the page's URL: `?key=...`
Chain ID of the network. For instance, 100 in the case of xDai chain.
JSON RPC endpoint of the chain for the WalletConnect integration. Implemented in [#4931](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4931)
New blocks indexed max delay in /health API endpoint. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#2294](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/2294/)
Add public tag labels. More info in [#6316](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6316)
Specify addresses for some label. More info in [#6316](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6316)
Enable API V2. Implemented in [#6361](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6361)
Bottom block for token id migration. Implemented in [#6391](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6391)
Number of workers performing the token id migration. Implemented in [#6391](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6391)
Interval of token transfer block numbers processed by a token id migration worker at a time. Implemented in [#6391](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6391)
Value of this env will be added to domain of session cookie. Implemented in [#6544](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6544)
Allows to decode contract calls directed to addresses which are not contracts. Implemented in [#6541](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6541)
EIP-1559 elasticity multiplier. Implemented in [#7253](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7253)
Fallback JSON RPC HTTP url. Implemented in [#7246](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7246)
Fallback JSON RPC trace url. Implemented in [#7246](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7246)
API key to protect some sensitive endpoints. Implemented in [#7355](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7355)
Description
Transformer for blocks: base or clique.
If `true`, indexer application doesn't run.
If `true`, indexer progress alert will be disabled even if initial catchup indexing is still in place. Implemented in [#7360](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7360).
If `true`, pending transactions fetcher is disabled.
If `true`, internal transactions fetcher is disabled.
if `true`, block rewards fetcher is disabled.
If `true`, coin balances fetcher is disabled.
If `true`, cataloged tokens metadata fetcher is disabled.
Memory soft limit for the indexer.
Batch size for empty block sanitizer (re-fetcher).
Batch size for blocks catchup fetcher. Implemented in [#6196](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6196).
Concurrency for blocks catchup fetcher. Implemented in [#6196](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6196).
Empty blocks sanitizer is disabled if `true`
If `true`, realtime fetcher doesn't run
The block number, where import of blocks by catchup fetcher begins from.
The block number, where import of blocks by catchup fetcher stops.
The block number, where indexing of internal transactions begins from.
The block number, where indexing of internal transactions stops.
Block ranges to import by catchup fetcher. Implemented in [#5783](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5783)
Tells the application how to calculate block rewards, by fetching via json\_rpc (`trace_block`) or manual by block params (`manual`).

Timeout for `debug_traceTransaction` JSON RPC method request in case of `geth` archive node. Supported time formats: [https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration). Introduced in [#5505](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5505)
If `true`, all the requests with the method `eth_getBalance` with any block as parameter but `latest` are ignored. Implemented in [#6001](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6001)

Defines which method will be used for fetching pending transactions: `default` - default method for fetching internal transactions for current `ETHEREUM_JSONRPC_VARIANT`, `geth` - `txpool_content` method will be used, `parity` - `parity_pendingTransactions` will be used. Implemented in [#6001](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6155)
Batch size for internal transactions fetcher. Implemented in [#6450](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6450).
Concurrency for internal transactions fetcher. Implemented in [#6450](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6450).

In the case when the 1st tx in the chain already has internal transactions, If the number of blocks in pending_block_operations is less than the value in this env var, Blockscout will consider, that indexing of internal transactions finished, otherwise, it will consider, that indexing is still taking place and the indexing banner will appear at the top. Implemented in [#7576](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7576).
Batch size for block reward fetcher. Implemented in [#6952](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6952).
Concurrency for block reward fetcher. Implemented in [#6952](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6952).
Batch size for transaction receipts fetcher. Implemented in [#6454](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6454).
Concurrency for transaction receipts fetcher. Implemented in [#6454](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6454).
Batch size for coin balances fetcher. Implemented in [#6454](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6454).
Concurrency for coin balances fetcher. Implemented in [#6454](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6454).
Batch size for token balances fetcher. Implemented in [#7439](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7439).
If `true`, transaction action indexer is active. Implemented in [#6582](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6582).
Maximum number of items in an internal cache of tx actions indexing process (to limit memory consumption). Implemented in [#6582](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6582).
The first block of a block range for historical indexing or reindexing of tx actions. Implemented in [#6582](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6582).
The last block of a block range for historical indexing or reindexing of tx actions. Implemented in [#6582](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6582).

Comma-separated names of protocols which should be indexed or reindexed on historical blocks defined by the range. Example: `uniswap_v3,zkbob` - only these protocols will be indexed or reindexed for the defined block range. If the value is empty string (or not defined), all supported protocols will be indexed/reindexed. This option is not applicable to `realtime` and `catchup` fetchers (it always indexes all supported protocols). Implemented in [#6582](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6582).
Pool contract address for Aave v3 protocol. If not defined, Aave transaction actions are ignored by the indexer. Implemented in [#7185](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7185).
UniswapV3Factory contract address. Implemented in [#7312](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7312).
NonfungiblePositionManager contract address for Uniswap v3. Implemented in [#7312](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7312).
Batch size for missing ranges collector. Implemented in [#6583](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6583).
Batch size for min missing block number updater. Implemented in [#6583](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6583).

Tracer type for `debug_traceTransaction` request for geth-like nodes. Possible values are: `js` to use custom Blockscout js tracer, `call_tracer` to use built-in `callTracer` geth tracer, `opcode` to use built-in `Struct/opcode logger` geth tracer, `polygon_edge` to work with Polygon edge nodes. Implemented in [#6721](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6721), [#7513](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7513)
Interval between attempts to fetch token instance metadata. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#7286](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7286).
Concurrency for `retry` token instance fetcher. Implemented in [#7286](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7286).
Concurrency for `realtime` token instance fetcher. Implemented in [#7286](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7286).
Concurrency for `sanitize` token instance fetcher. Implemented in [#7286](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7286).
If `true`, `retry` token instance fetcher doesn't run
If `true`, `realtime` token instance fetcher doesn't run
If `true`, `sanitize` token instance fetcher doesn't run
Max gap between consecutive `latest` blocks that will be filled by realtime fetcher. Implemented in [#7393](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7393)
If `true`, withdrawals fetcher is disabled. Implemented in [#6694](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6694).

The block number, where import of withdrawals by catchup fetcher begins from. Should be the block where withdrawals upgrade occurred on the chain. Implemented in [#6694](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6694).
Interval between blocks catchup fetcher tasks. Implemented in [#7489](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7489).
Limit for all fetchers init queries. Implemented in [#7697](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7697).
Description
Disables or enables fetching of coin price from Coingecko API.
This environment variable is used to calculate the exchange rates. Available value is `token_bridge`. Available values are also `coin_gecko` and `coin_market_cap`.
Mobula coin ID for token exchange rates.
Mobula API key for token exchange rates.
Mobula chain id full list in [doc](https://docs.mobula.io/blockchains/intro-blockchains).
Explicitly set CoinGecko coin ID.
CoinGecko API key.
CoinMarketCap API key.
CoinMarketCap coin id.
if `true` explorer application will fetch btc\_value for token exchange rates. Implemented in [#5671](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5671).

[CoinGecko](https://www.coingecko.com/) platform id for which token prices are fetched, see full list in [`/asset_platforms`](https://api.coingecko.com/api/v3/asset_platforms) endpoint. Implemented in [#6925](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6925).

Interval between batch requests of token prices. Can be decreased in order to fetch prices faster if you have pro rate limit. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#6925](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6925).

Interval between refetching token prices, responsible for the relevance of prices. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#6925](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6925).
Batch size of a single token price request. Implemented in [#6925](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6925).
If `true` disables fetching of token price. Implemented in [#6925](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6925).
Description
Time interval to restart the task, which calculates the total txs count. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
time to live of addresses sum (except burn address) cache. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Introduced in [#2862](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/2862).
Interval to restart the task, which calculates the total gas usage. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Time interval to restart the task, which calculates the total pending_block_operations count. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Interval to restart the task, which calculates gas usage at the address. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Interval to restart the task, which calculates holders count of the token. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Interval to restart the task, which calculates transfers count of the token. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Interval to restart the task, which calculates addresses with balances. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Interval to restart the task which updates token metadata. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Update of average block period cache. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Update of market history cache. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Time to live of address' transactions counter. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Introduced in [#3330](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/3330).
Managing of cache invalidation period for the sum of USD value of tokens per tokens' holder address. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
value which is to tune the time to live of exchange rates. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#5671](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5671).
A threshold to invalidate token balance cache. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
A threshold to invalidate coin balance cache. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).

Interval to restart the task, which calculates the number of token transfers at the address. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#4699](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/4699).
time to live of blocks with consensus count cache. . [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Introduced in [#1876](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/1876).
if `true`, enables cache for total gas usage counter.
Description
Gas price oracle: number of blocks to calculate average gas price from
Gas price oracle: safelow percentile
Gas price oracle: average percentile
Gas price oracle: fast percentile
Gas price oracle: period of gas prices update. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Description
Gas price in Gwei. If the variable is present, gas price displays on the main page.
Disables or enables txs per day stats gathering.
Disables or enables price and market cap of coin charts on the main page.
Allows to show price and market cap values under the chart even if price chart is not enabled via `SHOW_PRICE_CHART` env variable.
Disables or enables txs count per day chart on the main page.
The initial delay in txs count history fetching in order to display txs count per day history chart on the main page. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format).
Number of days for fetching of history of txs count per day in order to display it in txs count per day history chart on the main page.
Description

Environment variable for the header logo image location. The logo files names for different chains can be found [here](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/tree/master/apps/block\_scout\_web/assets/static/images).
Enables testnet label right after logo in the navigation panel. Implemented in [#5732](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5732)
The text inside the test label. Implemented in [#5732](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5732)

An array of supported chains that display in the footer and in the chains dropdown. This var was introduced in this PR [#1900](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/1900) and looks like an array of JSON objects.
column4: \[ { title: "POA", url: "https://blockscout.com/poa/core" }, { title: "Sokol", url: "https://blockscout.com/poa/sokol", test\_net?: true }, { title: "Gnosis Chain", url: "https://gnosis.blockscout.com" }, { title: "Ethereum Classic", url: "https://etc.blockscout.com", other?: true }, { title: "RSK", url: "https://rootstock.blockscout.com", other?: true } ]

column3: true/false. If true, the Apps navigation menu item appears.

An array of embedded/external apps to display in Apps menu item. This var was introduced in this PR [#3184](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/3184) and looks like an array of JSON objects. An example of embedded link is described here [#](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6397)
Description

Environment variable for the footer logo image location. The logo files names for different chains can be found [here](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/tree/master/apps/block\_scout\_web/assets/static/images).
The link to Blockscout release notes in the footer.
Added to the footer to signify the current BlockScout version.
Link in Chat menu item in the footer. Implemented in [#5719](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5719).
Enable forum menu item in the footer.
Link in Forum menu item in the footer. Implemented in [#5719](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5719)
Enable Telegram menu item in the footer. Implemented in [#7345](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7345).
Link in Telegram menu item in the footer. Implemented in [#7345](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7345).
Github repository. Implemented in [#5719](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5719).
true/false. If true, links to other explorers are added in the footer.
The list of alternative explorers.
Description

the comma-separated list of allowed EVM versions for Solidity contract verification. This var was introduced in [#1964](https://github.com/poanetwork/blockscout/pull/1964), updated in [#7614](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7614)
the comma-separated list of allowed EVM versions for Vyper contract verification. This var was introduced in [#7614](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7614)
Max amount of libraries to consider in smart-contract verification from flat/multi-part file(s). Implemented in [#6204](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6204)
Hide long contract method data. For more details: [#4667](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4667)
If `true`, contract interactions via "Write contract" or "Write proxy contract" tabs are disabled. Introduced in [#7088](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7088)
Description
Configures market cap percentage column on the top accounts page.
Disables/enables announcement at the top of the explorer.
Message text of the announcement at the top of the explorer.
Hides miner/validator/sequencer on block page and tiles if the value is \`true\` Implemented in [#4611](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4611)
Displays token icons from TrustWallet assets repository if `true`. Implemented in [#4596](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4596)
Include or exclude non-consensus blocks in avg block time calculation. Exclude if `false`.
Number of days to consider at coin balance history chart.
if `true` admin/\* routes are available. Implemented in [#5208](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5208)
If `true`, "Add chain to MM" button doesn't appear. Implemented in [#6843](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6843)
If `true`, permanent dark mode is enabled. Dark mode switcher is hidden in this case. Implemented in [#6763](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6763)
If `true`, permanent light mode is enabled. Dark mode switcher is hidden. Implemented in [#6838](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6838)

column1: reCAPTCHA v2 and v3 keys for CSV export page. Do not use both v2/v3 keys. Only one version of reCAPTCHA should be used.

column3: Description
Google reCAPTCHA v2 secret key. Used by advanced CSV export. Implemented in [#4747](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4747)
Google reCAPTCHA v2 client key. Used by advanced CSV export. Implemented in [#4747](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4747)
Google reCAPTCHA v3 secret key. Used by advanced CSV export. Implemented in [#7273](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7273)
Google reCAPTCHA v3 client key. Used by advanced CSV export. Implemented in [#7273](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7273)
Disable reCAPTCHA. Implemented in [#7416](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7416)
Description
A global API rate limit: number or requests per second for all users. Implemented in [#5030](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5030)
A dedicated API rate limit for a static API key. Implemented in [#5080](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5080)
Comma-separated whitelisted IPs list with dedicated rate limit. Implemented in [#5090](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5090)
Static API key with dedicated API rate limit. Implemented in [#5080](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5080)
If `true`, any type of rate limit is ignored. Implemented in [#6908](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6908)

If `true`, then IP address of a client will be derived from proxy's headers (like `X-Forwarded-For`) using [RemoteIp](https://hexdocs.pm/remote_ip/RemoteIp.html) library. Implemented in [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
A dedicated API rate limit for whitelisted IPs. Implemented in [#5090](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5090)
Global rate limit for an IP address for API v2 requests sent from UI. [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
Redis DB URL for Hammer rate limit library. Implemented in [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
Rate limit after submitting correct CAPTCHA. Implemented in [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
Time interval of rate limit. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
Time interval of rate limit set by `API_RATE_LIMIT_BY_IP`. [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format). Implemented in [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
TTL for token issued after submitting correct CAPTCHA for an API v2 requests from UI. In seconds. Implemented in [#7148](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7148)
Description
This environment variable is specifically used by POA Network to obtain Validators information to display in the UI.
This environment variable is specifically used by POA Network to obtain the list of current validators.

This environment variable is specifically used by POA Network to set KeysManager proxy contract in order to obtain payout key by mining key. This needs to identify distributed reward to the validator.
Emission rewards contract address. This env var is used only if `EMISSION_FORMAT` is set to `POA`
Token bridge proxy contract. For \`TokenBridge\` supply module.
Description
Turn on/off account functionality. If value is`true`, account functionality is enabled.
Account DB connection string
Account Redis connection string (for session storing configuration)
Account DB `pool_size`
Domain for [Ueberauth Auth0](https://hexdocs.pm/ueberauth\_auth0/readme.html)
Auth0 client ID [Ueberauth Auth0](https://hexdocs.pm/ueberauth\_auth0/readme.html)
Auth0 client secret [Ueberauth Auth0](https://hexdocs.pm/ueberauth\_auth0/readme.html)
Airtable URL for public tag requests functionality
Airtable API key for public tag requests functionality
Sendgrid API key for watchlist notifications functionality
Sendgrid sender email for watchlist notifications functionality
Sendgrid email template for watchlist notifications functionality
Account DB encryption key. [Instruction how to generate](https://hexdocs.pm/cloak\_ecto/generate\_keys.html#content)
Time before resending confirmation email. Implemented in [#7298](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7298). [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format)
Description

If `true`, integration with [Rust smart-contract verifier](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout-rs/tree/main/smart-contract-verifier) is enabled. Implemented in [#5860](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5860)
URL of Rust smart-contract verifier. Implemented in [#5860](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/5860)

Minimal time after unsuccessful check of smart contract's sources in Eth Bytecode DB. Implemented in [#7187](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7187). [Time format](env-variables.md#time-format)
Type of smart contract microservice could be either `eth_bytecode_db` or `sc_verifier`. Implemented in [#7187](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/7187)
Description

If `true`, integration with [Rust sol2uml visualizer](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout-rs/tree/main/visualizer) is enabled. Implemented in [#6401](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6401)
URL of Rust visualizer. Implemented in [#6401](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6401)
Description

If `true`, integration with [Rust sig-provider service](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout-rs/tree/main/sig-provider) is enabled. Implemented in [#6541](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/6541)

Description
Enables or disables verification of contracts through Sourcify.

Description
if `true`, "Open in Tenderly" button is displayed on the transaction page. Implemented in [#4656](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4656)

Chain path to the transaction in Tenderly. For instance, for transactions in xDai, Tenderly link looks like this https://dashboard.tenderly.co/tx/xdai/0x..., then `TENDERLY_CHAIN_PATH =/xdai.` Implemented in [#4656](https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout/pull/4656)
